{{redirect|Pegged||Peg (disambiguation)}} {{pp-move-indef|}} {{refimprove|date=December 2007}} {{Infobox VG |title= Microsoft Entertainment Pack |image= [[Image:WinEntPack.jpg|200px]] |caption= |developer= Microsoft |publisher= [[Microsoft Game Studios]] |distributor= Microsoft |designer= Robert Andrews |series= Entertainment Pack |engine= |version= |released= 1989 |genre= |modes= [[Single-player]] |ratings= |platforms= [[Windows 3.1x|Windows 3.x]], [[Windows 95]], [[Windows 98]] or Higher (32- Bit only) |media= |requirements= |input= }} [[Image:Chip's Challenge.png|thumb|[[Chip's Challenge]]]] The original '''[[Microsoft Windows]] Entertainment Pack''' ('''WEP''') is a collection of simply-designed [[16-bit]] computer games for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]. These games were somewhat unusual for the time, in that they would not run under [[MS-DOS]]. Many of the games (still compatible with [[Windows XP]]) were later released in the [[Best of Windows Entertainment Pack]]. There were four Entertainment Packs in the original series. All games being 16-bit run on modern 32-bit versions of Windows but not on 64-bit Windows, except through a virtual machine.

(game)|Go Figure!]] * [[Golf (card game)|Golf]] (a card game)^ * [[IdleWild (game)|IdleWild]] (a [[screensaver]] program) * [[JezzBall]]^ * [[Jigsawed]] (a Jigsaw puzzle) * [[Klotski]] * [[Life Genesis]] (based on the [[Conway's Game of Life|Life simulation]] by John Horton Conway) * [[Maxwell's Maniac]] * [[Minesweeper (Windows)|Minesweeper]]# * [[Pegged (game)|Pegged]] (a form of [[Peg solitaire]]) * [[Pipe Dream (video game)|Pipe Dream]] (by [[LucasArts]])^ * [[Rattler Race]] * [[Rodent's Revenge]]^ * [[SkiFree]]^ * [[Stones (game)|Stones]] * [[Taipei (game)|Taipei]]^ * [[Tetravex]]^ * [[Tetris]] (Windows version)^ * [[Tic Tac Drop]] (a form of [[Connect Four]] with quadrilateral, triangular and plus-shaped boards and customizable win pattern and number of rows and columns) * [[TicTactics]] (a [[Tic-tac-toe]] variant) * [[Tri Peaks|TriPeaks]] (a card game)^ * [[Tut's Tomb]] (a card game)^ * [[WordZap]] (a word game) ** ** ^ Included in ''[[Best of Windows Entertainment Pack]]'' ** <nowiki>#</nowiki> Bundled in some later versions of Windows
==GameSampler== For much of the early 1990s, the Gamesampler, a subset of the Entertainment Pack called small enough to fit on a single [[Floppy_disk#The_3.C2.BD-inch_microfloppy_diskette|high-density disk]], was shipped as a free eleventh disk added to a ten-pack of [[Verbatim Corporation|Verbatim]] blank 3.5" microfloppy diskettes. Games on the sampler included Jezzball, Rodent's Revenge, Tetris, and Skifree. A "Best of" disk of several of the games was also available at times as a mail-in premium from [[Kellogg's]] cereals.
==32-bit versions== In the copies of [[Windows NT 4.0]] and [[Windows 2000]] source code which leaked back in 2004, there are 32-bit versions of Cruel, Golf, Pegged, Reversi, Snake (Rattler Race), Taipei and TicTactics. <ref> [http://www.kuro5hin.org/comments/2004/2/15/71552/7795/119#119 We Are Morons: a quick look at the Win2k source] </ref> However, [[Freecell]] and [[Minesweeper (Windows)|Minesweeper]] have had official 32-bit versions bundled even with early versions of [[Windows NT]]. The original game developers of some of the games such as SkiFree <ref> [http://ski.ihoc.net/ The most officialest SkiFree homepage] </ref>, TriPeaks <ref> [http://www.rhogue.com/tripeaks/tripeaks.htm TriPeaks Homepage] </ref>, WordZap <ref> [http://wordzap.com/downloads.asp#Classic Classic WordZap] </ref> now offer 32-bit versions. Third party developers have also created 32-bit freeware clones of Klotski <ref> [http://phil.freehackers.org/klotski/ Klotski homepage] </ref>, TetraVex <ref> [http://delphi.about.com/od/gameprogramming/a/tetravex.htm Tetravex Game in Delphi] </ref> Rodent's Revenge <ref> [http://web.archive.org/web/20070822075641/http://www.emu8086.com/vb/rodent.html Rodent's Revenge 2000] </ref>, JezzBall <ref> [http://gametop.com/download-free-games/jezzball/ J-Ball] </ref>, and Tetris. <ref> [http://www.crystaloffice.com/games/ CrystalOffice Games] </ref>
==Port to the Game Boy Color== A [[multicart]] containing seven games was released for the [[Game Boy Color]] as simply Microsoft Entertainment Pack. Four of the games on the multi-cart were ported from Best of Microsoft Entertainment Pack, while the remaining three were ported from other Microsoft Entertainment Pack compilations.
Games found on the GBC Microsoft Entertainment Pack mult-cart:
* Tut's Tomb * TriPeaks * FreeCell * TicTactics<sup>*</sup> * Minesweeper<sup>*</sup> * Life Genesis<sup>*</sup> * SkiFree
<small><sup>*</sup>Not included in the original Best of Windows Entertainment Pack.</small>
